Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Players

Class AdapterPlayers

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
Model.Players.AdapterPlayers
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IPlayers
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlayerGPU, PlayerHuman
public abstract class AdapterPlayers extends Thread implements IPlayers
The AdapterPlayers abstract class serves as the base implementation for all player types participating in the card game.

It implements the IPlayers interface and extends Thread, allowing each player to run concurrently if needed.

Each player maintains:

  • A hand of cards
  • A turn identifier
  • Access to the shared deck and card pile
  • A reference to the TurnManager
  • A synchronization lock for turn-based gameplay

This class provides base behavior such as drawing cards, checking playable cards, and placing cards onto the central pile. Subclasses must implement specific gameplay behavior (e.g., human input or AI decisions).

Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • AdapterPlayers

      public AdapterPlayers(Deck deck, int myTurn, Object lock, TurnManager turnManager, CardPile cardPile, String playerType)
      Creates a new player adapter with all necessary game components.
      Parameters:
      deck - the shared deck used to draw cards
      myTurn - the turn number assigned to the player
      lock - the synchronization lock controlling turn access
      turnManager - the manager responsible for turn sequencing
      cardPile - the central pile where played cards accumulate
      playerType - a string identifying the player type

    • AdapterPlayers

      public AdapterPlayers(Deck deck)
      Creates a simplified player adapter using only a deck. This constructor automatically marks the player as active.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck used for drawing cards

    • putCard

      public void putCard(int indexCard, CardPile cardPile) throws InvalidCardException
      Attempts to play the card at the given index.

      Validates that the card does not cause the pile to exceed 50 points. Special handling is applied for Ace cards (A), which may adopt two values.

      Specified by:
      putCard in interface IPlayers
      Parameters:
      indexCard - the position of the card in the player's hand
      cardPile - the pile where the card should be placed
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if the resulting pile value exceeds 50
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is outside the handâ€™s bounds

    • takeHand

      public void takeHand()
      Clears the player's hand and draws a fresh hand containing up to 4 cards. Fewer cards may be drawn if the deck is depleted.
      Specified by:
      takeHand in interface IPlayers

    • getIsPlaying

      public boolean getIsPlaying()
      Returns whether the player is still active in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the player is active; false otherwise

    • hasValidCards

      public boolean hasValidCards()
      Determines whether the player has any legal moves available.

      A legal move is one in which a card can be played without the pile value exceeding 50. Ace cards receive special handling due to their dual-value nature.

      If the player has no valid cards, they are automatically eliminated.

      Returns:
      true if at least one card is playable; false otherwise

    • getIsplaying

      public boolean getIsplaying()
      Returns whether the player is still participating in the game. (Duplicate accessor maintained for compatibility.)
      Returns:
      true if the player is still active; false otherwise

    • getTurn

      public int getTurn()
      Returns the player's assigned turn number.
      Returns:
      the numeric turn identifier

    • initializePlayer

      public void initializePlayer()
      Initializes the player at the start of a match.

      This method:

      • Marks the player as active
      • Draws an initial hand of cards
